title: Secretary (Female) Job at BuildSpace Technology Hub
content:
BuildSpace Technology Hub - We are an innovative tech company based in Makurdi, Benue State, focused on delivering digital solutions that drive business growth and efficiency.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Secretary (Female)

Job Location: Makurdi, Benue
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Technology / IT Services

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are an innovative tech company based in Makurdi, Benue State, focused on delivering digital solutions that drive business growth and efficiency.
	As we expand our operations, we are looking for a female Secretary to join our team and support our day-to-day administrative and project coordination activities.


Job Summary


	The ideal candidate will be responsible for providing administrative support, managing communication, and assisting in project-related tasks as needed.
	The candidate must be proactive, detail-oriented, well-organized, and able to multitask in a dynamic tech environment.


Key Responsibilities
Administrative Support:


	Manage daily office operations and provide clerical and administrative assistance to the team.
	Schedule meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.
	Prepare and manage correspondence, reports, presentations, and other documents.
	Maintain efficient and organized filing systems, both physical and electronic.
	Handle incoming calls, emails, and office inquiries professionally.


Project Execution Support:


	Assist in the coordination and execution of projects as assigned by supervisors or project leads.
	Track the progress of tasks and ensure timely completion of assigned responsibilities.
	Participate in project meetings and document action items, decisions, and timelines.
	Collaborate with team members to meet project objectives and deadlines.


Task Accountability & Communication:


	Ensure all assigned tasks are completed accurately and on time.
	Maintain clear and consistent communication with supervisors and team members.
	Promptly report any challenges, roadblocks, or delays that may affect task delivery.
	Follow up with relevant stakeholders to ensure continuous task progression.


External Representation:


	Visit other companies, agencies, or partners on behalf of the company when required.
	Deliver documents, attend external meetings, and represent the company professionally.
	Build and maintain positive relationships with external contacts as assigned.


Additional Duties:


	Carry out any other responsibilities as assigned by the supervisor or management.
	Support various teams with ad hoc administrative or project-related tasks as needed.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND or equivalent; a degree in Office Management, Administration, or a related field is an advantage.
	Must be female and reside within or very close to Lobi Quarters, Makurdi.
	Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Google Workspace tools.
	Ability to prioritize tasks and work with minimal supervision.
	Professional demeanor and good interpersonal skills.
	Previous experience as a secretary or administrative assistant is an added advantage.


What We Offer


	Monthly salary ranging from N50,000 to N77,000, based on experience and performance.
	A dynamic work environment in the tech industry.
	Opportunity for career growth and skills development.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and Cover Letter to: talent.hunt1@yahoo.com using “Application for Female Secretary – Makurdi" as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only candidates residing within or around Lobi Quarters, Makurdi will be considered.

title: Social Media Manager Job at Victoriasid Travels and Tours
content:
Victoriasid Travels and Tours is a leading travel and tours company committed to providing seamless and budget-friendly travel experiences. Our services include expertly curated travel packages, visa processing, second passport acquisition, and citizenship programs. Whether for leisure, business, or relocation, we ensure hassle-free solutions tailored our clients needs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager
Job Location: Kado, Abuja (Hybrid, 2-3 days onsite weekly)

About the Role
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a creative, smart, and dedicated Social Media Manager to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing our social media presence across Instagram, Facebook, and TikTok, with a focus on promoting travel-related content.
	This is a hybrid position, with onsite presence required 2–3 times a week for content creation, team collaboration, and performance reporting.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and grow our presence across Instagram, Facebook, and TikTok
	Develop,Design, schedule, and publish engaging travel content
	Collaborate with the team on content strategy and campaign planning
	Monitor analytics and provide regular reports on performance

Requirements


	Must be presentable, tech-savvy, and camera-friendly
	Strong understanding of content creation, page growth, and community engagement

Preferred Qualifications:


	Previous experience managing social media for a travel agency is a strong plus

Work Schedule:


	Hybrid role: Report to the office 2–3 times per week

title: Job Vacancies at MBIS International
content:
MBIS International, a reputable Nursery and Primary education, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the following positions below:

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Experienced Female School Receptionist

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are a prestigious school dedicated to academic excellence and holistic development of our pupils.
	As we continue to expand, we are seeking a highly skilled, effective, and proficient receptionist with an effervescent personality someone who is naturally happy, involved, and articulate  to join our dynamic nursery and primary school.
	Our expectations are very high, and we are unapologetically focused on excellent oral and written communication within our school community.
	As our receptionist, you will be the first point of call for visitors to the school, parents, staff and children.
	As the ‘face’ of the school, you will be welcoming, personable, and helpful; being able to represent us in a professional and friendly manner.
	In addition, it is essential that you are organised, be able to multi-task, work flexibly and have a ‘can do’ approach to work, as no two days are the same.
	If you are passionate about education, have a strong administrative background, and are ready to take on a multifaceted role, we would love to hear from you!


Key Responsibilities


	Serve as the first point of contact for parents, staff, and visitors, ensuring a warm and professional welcome.
	Manage front desk operations efficiently in a fast-paced school environment.
	Handle phone calls, emails, and correspondence with utmost professionalism and accuracy.
	Respond to phone and walk-in school enquiries, ensuring timely and helpful assistance.
	Maintain organised and detailed records, ensuring smooth administrative processes.
	Take initiative in problem-solving and supporting the school’s operational needs.
	Coordinate appointments, meetings, and school events effectively


Administrative:


	Printing of all learning resources, workbooks, assessments, timetables and calendars
	Assisting with the production of school publications; collating, printing of timetables, examination scripts, collation of marks and printing of school reports
	Assisting with basic accounting functions, such as cross-checking produced school bills, circulating, processing and reconciling all fee payments
	Ensuring that all after school enrichment programmes are running smoothly and in line with safeguarding procedures
	Diary management of all school meetings and events
	Processing medication and incident report forms in collaboration with the welfare officer
	Participating in school meetings, parent information day and parent-teacher conferences
	Actively involved in public relations and marketing activities; including daily social media postings on our social media platforms.


Requirements


	Must live within commuting distance of Jericho, Ibadan.
	A Bachelor’s degree in Education or Management
	A minimum of 3 years sustained post-graduation experience in administration within an educational environment.
	Proven experience as a receptionist or administrative professional in a high-standard organisation; preferably a school.
	Exceptional attention to detail, organisation, and ability to multitask.
	Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and administrative tools
	A proactive problem-solver who is resourceful, positive, and enthusiastic.
	Strong interpersonal skills and a calm, professional approach.
	Flexible and adaptable in a fast-paced environment.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a demanding and high-expectation environment.
	A naturally effervescent personality that reflects a happy, involved, and articulate nature
	Ability to cope with periods of pressure and meet deadlines
	A high level of professionalism and a smart appearance.


Application Closing Date: 15th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their recent full-length photograph, along with their cover letter and CV (detailing how they meet the above requirements): eyfsrecruitment@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: If you meet these high standards and are ready to make a meaningful impact in our school community, we would love to hear from you!.

 

2.) Academic Corordinator

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a dedicated, highly organised, and ethically grounded Academic Coordinator to lead and supervise the academic arm of our Nursery and Primary School.
	This role is pivotal to ensuring teaching quality, curriculum fidelity, assessment integrity, and learner progress.
	If you are passionate about education, can mentor teachers, unafraid to uphold high standards and step in when necessary to maintain continuity in instruction, this leadership opportunity is for you.


About the Role


	As Academic Coordinator, you will oversee all aspects of teaching and assessment. You will be responsible for ensuring consistent, high-quality lesson delivery, using the school’s structured British curriculum materials.
	You will also be expected to provide instructional support and guidance to teachers, and when needed, step into the classroom to cover lessons and ensure no learning time is lost.
	This is not just a supervisory role — it is an active, hands-on leadership position that requires deep engagement with daily teaching and learning.


Core Responsibilities
Your day-to-day tasks will include:
Instructional Oversight & Support:


	Coordinate and supervise daily teaching activities in all Nursery and Primary classes
	Conduct lesson observations to confirm alignment with the school-provided curriculum materials and provide professional feedback to staff
	Provide on-the-ground support to teachers during instructional hours
	Step into the classroom to cover lessons when a teacher is absent or unavailable
	Mentor teachers on instructional techniques, marking consistency, and professional conduct


Assessment & Reporting:


	Ensure timely and accurate administration and marking of all school-based assessments
	Track teacher performance, learner progress, and marking standards
	Support the preparation and timely submission of pupil progress reports
	Ensure all pupil reports are accurate, comprehensive, and submitted on time


Curriculum & Academic Planning;


	Collaborate with the school’s Curriculum Director on curriculum execution and academic performance goals
	Liaise with school leadership on curriculum reviews, learner needs, and staffing gaps


Staff Development & Coordination:


	Contribute to teacher recruitment, onboarding, and development
	Attend academic meetings, training sessions, and instructional reviews


Minimum Requirements
Applicants must meet all of the following criteria:


	Bachelor’s degree in Education (B.Ed); a PGDE is a plus
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in an academic leadership or supervisory role
	Strong background in primary-level instruction within a structured school system
	TRCN certification is highly desirable
	Exceptional written and spoken English communication skills
	Highly proficient in: Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and email communication
	Strong understanding of lesson planning, curriculum alignment, assessment cycles, and pupil tracking
	Proven ability to mentor teachers and enforce academic standards
	High standards of professionalism, consistency and ethical conduct


What We’re Looking For:


	This role goes beyond administration—it is hands-on instructional leadership at its core. We’re seeking a confident, proactive leader who is deeply committed to academic excellence, consistent standards, and continuous school improvement.


The ideal candidate will:


	Have a clear vision for academic excellence and consistency, and work daily to uphold it across all classes
	Be fully present, hands-on, and engaged in daily teaching and learning practices
	Lead by example, demonstrating high-quality teaching, strong work ethic, and professional integrity
	Mentor and manage teaching staff with both firmness and support, fostering growth while holding everyone to non-negotiable standards
	Inspire teachers while confidently challenging mediocrity and addressing underperformance
	Be passionate about curriculum integrity, learner progress, and assessment accountability
	Work practically and proactively to improve classroom practice and ensure learners are always progressing
	Operate with fairness, discretion, and strong ethical judgment in all decisions and interactions
	Be committed to the school’s academic mission, ready to solve problems and drive improvement daily.


Application Closing Date: 15th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, Cover letter describing their leadership experience and approach (Optional but encouraged), Any performance tracking samples, teacher feedback samples, or academic plans they have developed to: eyfsrecruitment@gmail.com using "Application for Academic Coordinator Position" as the subject of the mail.

Please Note


	Only candidates with a proven track record in academic leadership, curriculum supervision, and teacher management will be considered.
	This is a role for someone who leads by example, takes full ownership, and is committed to doing the work properly every day.
	If you are not prepared to model the standards you expect from others — including stepping into classrooms when necessary — please do not apply.


 

3.) Female Primary Teacher

Job Location: Jericho - Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking to appoint creative, responsible, and enthusiastic Primary Teachers to join our growing team.
	If you are an experienced educator with a growth mindset, a love for learning, and a passion for working with young pupils, then our children need you!
	Our school delivers a structured British curriculum, and we provide complete lesson plans, PowerPoints, and assessments to support your teaching.
	We seek candidates who are committed to excellence, ethical in practice, and dedicated to learner progress.


What We Provide


	Complete lesson plans, slides, and assessments
	Curriculum-aligned teaching resources
	Supportive training and regular staff development


Key Responsibilities


	Deliver all lessons using the school’s provided materials
	Mark all assigned pupil work promptly and professionally
	Administer assessments according to school guidelines
	Maintain a clean, organised, and engaging classroom environment
	Provide constructive written feedback in pupils’ books and communicate effectively with parents
	Work professionally under the direction of the Curriculum Director.


Essential Requirements
For your application to be considered, you must meet all of the following criteria:


	Female applicants only
	Minimum of 3 years of post-graduation experience teaching in a structured school setting
	TRCN certification is mandatory
	Must be a resident in Ibadan and live within a reasonable commuting distance of Jericho, Ibadan
	B.Ed in Primary Education Studies or B.Sc. with PGDE from a reputable institution
	Strong classroom management and excellent teaching skills in core subjects: English, Mathematics, and Science
	Able to teach a broad range of primary subjects
	Confident use of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and email
	Ability to adopt the school’s handwriting scheme and write legibly
	Excellent written and spoken English language skills
	Strong organisational skills and ability to maintain high-standard classroom displays
	High expectations for pupil behaviour, progress, and attainment
	Sound knowledge of learner tracking, assessment, and feedback
	Strong understanding of safeguarding practices in educational environments
	Have thorough understanding of best practices in teaching
	Willingness to use only school-provided lesson materials (no personal schemes)


Application Closing Date: 30th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, cover letter, and a brief lesson plan (in Mathematics or English) to: eyfsrecruitment@gmail.com using "Application for Primary Teaching Position" as the subject of the mail.

Important Interview Points to Note:
This role is not for candidates seeking to cut corners or avoid accountability. Applicants will be tested during the interview on:


	Marking standards
	Classroom management
	Professional ethics and responsibility.


Note


	Your cover letter and CV must clearly demonstrate your recent, relevant primary teaching experience.
	Applications that do not meet the listed requirements will not be considered.
	Only honest, hardworking, and ethical teachers will be considered. If you are not prepared to meet these expectations, please do not apply.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Openings at Cavista
content:
Cavista is a global technology company creating cloud-based software solutions for clients. With operations around the world, we globalize, standardize and localize our processes, while at the same time remaining sensitive to specific needs in different regions. Our mission is to empower organizations with the world’s best technology solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Business Operations Manager

Job Location: Ilupeju, Lagos

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Business Operations Manager is a critical leadership role designed to serve as a strategic partner to the General Manager, ensuring seamless business operations, driving organizational efficiency, and spearheading key initiatives.
	This position demands a visionary leader with a strong operational mindset, capable of optimizing processes, enhancing performance, and fostering cross-functional collaboration.
	The successful candidate will act as a force multiplier for the General Manager, stepping in to lead critical functions, manage stakeholder relationships, and execute high-impact projects that align with Cavista Technologies’ long term objectives.


Key Responsibilities


	Serve as the primary deputy to the General Manager, assuming leadership responsibilities in their absence, including executive decision-making, stakeholder engagements, and board-level presentations.
	Partner with the executive leadership team to formulate, refine, and execute the company’s strategic roadmap, ensuring alignment with Cavista Technologies mission, vision, and growth targets.
	Conduct comprehensive business analysis to identify operational inefficiencies, market opportunities, and areas for innovation, presenting data-driven recommendations to the leadership team.
	Oversee the implementation of key strategic initiatives, ensuring timely execution, resource optimization, and measurable outcomes.
	Lead the design and execution of operational strategies to enhance productivity, reduce costs, and improve service delivery across all business units.
	Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to evaluate business performance, providing actionable insights to drive continuous improvement.
	Streamline cross-functional workflows, fostering collaboration between Finance, People, Talent, IT and Delivery teams to ensure operational synergy.
	Champion the adoption of best practices, automation, and technology-driven solutions to elevate operational efficiency and scalability.
	In the absence of the General Manager, Cavista Technologies in high-level client meetings, negotiations, and industry forums, reinforcing the company’s reputation as a trusted technology partner.
	Analyze market trends, competitive landscapes, and emerging technologies to position Cavista Technologies as an industry leader.
	Act as a liaison between senior leadership and respective team leads, ensuring transparent communication, goal alignment, and conflict resolution.
	Ensure adherence to corporate governance standards, regulatory requirements, and internal compliance policies.
	Proactively identify operational, financial, and reputational risks, implementing mitigation strategies to safeguard business continuity.
	Align with the General Manager to oversee contract management, vendor relationships, and procurement processes to ensure cost efficiency and risk mitigation.


Qualifications


	Advanced Degree: MBA or master’s degree in business administration, Operations Management, or a related field from a reputed institution.
	Professional Experience: Minimum of 12+ years of progressive leadership experience in business operations, general management, or strategic consulting, with at least 5 years in a senior management role within the technology or IT services sector.
	Financial Literacy: Strong understanding of budgeting, financial analysis, and cost optimization.
	Industry Expertise: Demonstrated success in scaling operations, driving digital transformation, or managing P&L for technology-driven organizations.
	Strategic Vision: Ability to translate business objectives into actionable plans with measurable outcomes.
	Operational Acumen: Expertise in process optimization, lean management, and performance metrics.
	Leadership Excellence: Proven track record of building, leading, and inspiring high performing teams.
	Stakeholder Management: Exceptional negotiation, communication, and relationship building skills.
	Innovation Mindset: Passion for leveraging technology to solve complex business challenges.


Additional Information:


	5 - day workweek.
	Flextime.
	Competitive Health Insurance (Employee + Spouse + 4 children).
	Wellness Programs
	Employee Training Programs
	Growth and Development
	Remote working and IT Assets provided for Remote employees
	Mentoring and Counseling
	Referral Bonus
	Work from Anywhere - Flexibility that allows you to work where you are most comfortable, whether at home, at work, or a combination of both.


Click here to apply online

 

2.) IT Support Technician

Job Location: Ilupeju, Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Description


	We are seeking a highly skilled Female IT Support Technician to provide technical assistance and support for hardware, software, and network related issues across the organization.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for troubleshooting IT problems, maintaining systems, and ensuring smooth day to day operations for end users.
	This role requires expertise in Microsoft Azure, cloud infrastructure, and IT security best practices.


Responsibilities
What you will do:


	Provide first-line technical support to employees by diagnosing and resolving hardware, software, and network-related issues.
	Install, configure, and maintain computers, printers, mobile devices, and other IT equipment to ensure optimal performance.
	Monitor and maintain IT infrastructure, including servers, networks, and security systems, with a focus on Microsoft Azure cloud services.
	Manage Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) for user account provisioning, access controls, and security policies.
	Assist with user account management, including password resets, access requests, and system configurations.
	Respond to IT service requests and incidents in a timely manner, ensuring minimal disruption to operations.
	Perform system updates, patches, and software installations to maintain security and efficiency.
	Assist in IT asset inventory management, tracking and documenting IT equipment and licenses.
	Support remote employees by troubleshooting VPN, cloud-based systems, and remote desktop environments.
	Collaborate with the IT team on projects, upgrades, and implementation of new technologies, particularly Azure-based solutions.
	Implement Azure security best practices, including role-based access control (RBAC), identity protection, and endpoint security.
	Provide user training and guidance on IT best practices, cloud-based collaboration tools, and security protocols.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
	1-3 years of experience in IT support, helpdesk, or technical support roles.
	Proficiency in troubleshooting Windows, macOS, and Linux operating systems.
	Familiarity with ticketing systems and IT service management frameworks (e.g., ITIL).
	Knowledge of cybersecurity best practices, firewalls, and endpoint security.
	Hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure administration, including Azure AD, virtual machines, and cloud security.
	Strong knowledge of Active Directory, Office 365, networking protocols, and cloud-based services.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
	Strong problem-solving skills, customer service orientation, and excellent communication abilities.


Benefits


	Competitive Compensation 
	5 - day workweek
	Flextime
	Competitive Health Insurance (Employee + Spouse + 4 children)
	Wellness Programs
	Employee Training Programs
	Growth and Development

3.) Quality Assurance Engineer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Description


	Collaborate with Product Owners to review and analyze business and functional requirements and design documents for sound testing strategies. 
	Responsible for testing of a product, including writing the test plans and test cases, writing automation scripts, and testing the complete application from the UI through to the backend.

title: Project Manager (Nigeria) Job at BBC Media Action
content:
(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    

BBC Media Action is the BBC’s international development organisation, and we believe in the power of media and communication for good. We work in more than 20 countries around the world, supporting the independent media essential to democracy and development. Last year, our projects and programmes reached 130 million people facing poverty, inequality and insecurity with information they could trust, helping to improve health, bridge divides, challenge prejudice, and save and change lives. We follow the editorial standards and values of the BBC, but we rely on funding from donors and partners to carry out our work. BBC Media Action delivers a portfolio of projects in Nigeria. It seeks to expand this portfolio of work, but also to ensure that existing projects are delivered on time, on budget, to the highest standards and in accordance with BBC editorial values as well as Media Action methodologies.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager (Nigeria)

Job Location: Nigeria (Right to work in Nigeria required)
Reports to: Project Director
Contract: Fixed-term employment
Duration: One year

Job Purpose


	The BBC Media Action office in Nigeria is looking for a Project Manager to support the implementation of a reproductive and family planning project, making sure the agreed targets and objectives are met while ensuring the quality and alignment of project outputs to overall organisational objectives.
	The Project Manager will also ensure that all relevant organisational departments and project partners are kept abreast of project commitments, timelines, strategies and changes to ensure adequate resource allocation and successful project implementation.
	The Project Manager will also be responsible for the planning and coordination of project activities including financial management of the project and reporting on progress to the Project Director.
	S/He will coordinate with key stakeholders and will ensure effective relationships and partnerships with a wide range of partners including broadcasters, NGOs, international development agencies, government coordinating bodies, and others.
	The role reports to the Project Director and will work closely with other implementing teams and the Senior Management Team.


Main Duties and Responsibilities


	Oversee the planning and implementation of all activities for the project in accordance with project budget and timelines.
	Support the design and coordination of workshops, events, monitoring, evaluation and feedback/learning sessions, and work with relevant stakeholders to develop a comprehensive content roadmap for a multimedia, multiplatform, multi-partner SBC intervention
	Contribute to the articulation of the project’s theory of change and ensure that key research findings are fed into project design and delivery.
	Support the development of media content insofar as ensuring it links to the project ‘theory of change’ and intended development outcomes.
	Work with selected partners to develop a holistic evidence-based communication strategy for an SBC intervention on FP informed by detailed analysis and segmentation of audiences.
	Monitor project activities – working closely with relevant stakeholders and other teams to deliver the project and donor commitments while aligning with BBC editorial standards and values and Media Action’s best practice.
	Onboard and maintain strong, collaborative relationships with partners and organisations for the benefit of the project, in line with BBC Media Action values.
	Support the development of relevant project management tools that aid the effective design and implementation of project activities, to include but not limited to theory of change, logframe/results framework and workplans.
	Support the development of knowledge management systems and processes that help to collect, organize, store and share BBC Media Action Nigeria’s information/knowledge assets in a manner that such can be readily available, accessible and effectively used for the benefit of the organization.
	Manage project budgets (including budget forecasting) to ensure the full and successful delivery of project outputs in accordance with that budget and in line with Media Action’s financial procedures and the funder’s operating guidelines.
	Work closely with the Project Director and the Finance department to identify and resolve any potential financial issues.
	Negotiate and/or mediate conflicting views and priorities arising within the project or across departments/teams, to ensure solutions meet the needs of the project and BBC Media Action.
	Lead on reporting of project progress, both to donor, internally to BBC Media Action in Abuja and London, and externally to other stakeholders around the world.
	Contribute to the development and writing of new proposals, or working as part of a larger team responding to donor requirements.
	Coordinate with other relevant Project Managers and Media Action departments to build synergy between projects, to deliver the highest quality work at best value for the donor.
	Ensure that project activities comply with BBC Media Action and donor standards around safeguarding of children and vulnerable adults.
	The role will also lead or support to ensure that relevant safeguarding due diligence is conducted with any local partner organisations that may be working with vulnerable adults or children as part of the project and where any risks are identified, ensure that projects are designed to mitigate these risks.
	Any other tasks assigned by Media Action to achieve project and organisational objectives.


Required Skills, Knowledge, and Experience


	Strong technical understanding of and experience of working in reproductive and family planning projects, including media development and communications for behaviour and social change
	Experience managing complex activities with demonstrated capacity to manage the project/activities effectively.
	Proven ability to build consensus and inspire different teams or departments to work together to achieve goals.
	Ability to forge strong working relations quickly and gain the trust of colleagues and partners, for example in other international NGOs, in government, in media houses, and elsewhere.
	Experience managing activity budgets and reporting/providing updates against scheduled activities and/or spend.
